alert.note: Alert for Harlan; Leslie (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 16 at 2:48PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Harlan, southwestern Letcher, southeastern Leslie and southeastern Perry Counties through 315 PM EDT... At 248 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Big Laurel, or 9 miles northeast of Harlan, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Arthur, Nolansburg and Leatherwood around 255 PM EDT. Totz and Gilley around 300 PM EDT. Diane, Louellen, Black Bottom, Delphia and Lejunior around 305 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Hiram, Gordon, Cumberland, Lynch, Benham, Clutts, Kingdom Come S.P., Blair, Clover, Linefork, Rock House and Defeated Creek. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for southeastern Kentucky.
